block.p: Eileen Honor Ohnell, a daughter of Patricia R. Ohnell and Ernst Ohnell of Greenwich, Conn., was married yesterday to John Sang-Hyun Kim, the son of Sun-Bae Kim and Dr. Soo-Il Kim of Maple Glen, Pa. The Rev. Dr. Ronald Patterson performed the ceremony at Marble Collegiate Church in New York.

The bride, 26, will continue to use her name professionally. She was until last week the senior analyst at Southfield Investment Advisors, an investment management firm in Stamford, Conn. Next month she is to become a research analyst at Highbridge Capital Management, a hedge fund in New York. She graduated from Princeton University. Her father retired as the chief executive of the Communications Supply Corporation, a distributor of cable and other telecommunications equipment in Stamford. He is now an independent investment manager in Greenwich, and serves on the boards of the Storm King Art Center in Mountainville, N.Y., and St. Ann's School, a parochial school in Harlem.

Eileen Honor Ohnell, a daughter of Patricia R. Ohnell and Ernst Ohnell of Greenwich, Conn., was married yesterday to John Sang-Hyun Kim, the son of Sun-Bae Kim and Dr. Soo-Il Kim of Maple Glen, Pa. The Rev. Dr. Ronald Patterson performed the ceremony at Marble Collegiate Church in New York.

The bride, 26, will continue to use her name professionally. She was until last week the senior analyst at Southfield Investment Advisors, an investment management firm in Stamford, Conn. Next month she is to become a research analyst at Highbridge Capital Management, a hedge fund in New York. She graduated from Princeton University. Her father retired as the chief executive of the Communications Supply Corporation, a distributor of cable and other telecommunications equipment in Stamford. He is now an independent investment manager in Greenwich, and serves on the boards of the Storm King Art Center in Mountainville, N.Y., and St. Ann's School, a parochial school in Harlem.

Later this month, the bridegroom, 27, is to become an investment banking associate at Morgan Stanley Dean Witter in New York. He graduated from Yale University, from which he also received a law degree. His father is a senior research fellow in the Collegeville, Pa., office of Aventis, a pharmaceuticals company.
